intro: Chrysanthemum myconis var. hybridum, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, pompon-shaped flowers that come in a wide range of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its foliage is dark green and finely divided, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and used in traditional floral arrangements.
